  physical_appearance: This is a brass ewer. It has a pear-shaped body with flat sides. It has a slender handle on the left
 and an S-shaped spout on the right. There is a hinged lid
 and a circular
 flaring base. The body of the ewer is engraved with scrolling arabesque motifs.

  subject_terms_1: palmette (motif) ablutions Islamic (culture or style) ewers (vessels) scrolls (motifs)

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Ablutions (Islamic law) Islam Ewers

  subject_terms_3: Heritage and Culture

  sgcool_label_text: Because the Quran states that “we made everything alive from water” (surah 21:30)
 ewers carry great significance. Usually paired with a matching basin
 ewers are used by Muslims to wash their hands before prayer and many other acitivities. Because of their durability
 brass and bronze were commonly used to make ewers and other vessels to hold liquids.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a brass ewer. It has a pear-shaped body with flat sides. It has a slender handle on the left, and an S-shaped spout on the right. There is a hinged lid, and a circular, flaring base. The body of the ewer is engraved with scrolling arabesque motifs.
metadata.subject_terms_1: palmette (motif) ablutions Islamic (culture or style) ewers (vessels) scrolls (motifs)
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Because the Quran states that “we made everything alive from water” (surah 21:30), ewers carry great significance. Usually paired with a matching basin, ewers are used by Muslims to wash their hands before prayer and many other acitivities. Because of their durability, brass and bronze were commonly used to make ewers and other vessels to hold liquids.
